Key Arguments: Individuals are capable of analyzing information and making informed decisions without government intervention.
The legislation would give the government excessive power to monitor and suppress dissenting opinions.
The proposal includes exemptions that undermine its stated purpose of public safety.
Questions the financial costs and implementation details of the regulations.
Emphasizes the importance of protecting freedom of speech without restrictions.
Notable Quotes: An average person is more than capable of reading, researching and analyzing any information they come across and make their own informed decisions.
Freedom of speech is the core of human freedom and must remain protected and without any restriction and/or exemptions.
